titleStmt.title: Daniel W. Lindsey to Alfred L. Hough
CWG13944

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: Adjutant General Letter Book - No. 10 ; 10 Feb - 16 March 1865

body.p:
272
March 2d 5
Capt Alfred L Hough
Comr Musters Dept Cumbl
Nashville. Tenn
Captain

I have the honor to call your attention to the fact, that His Excellency the Governor of Kentucky has not received a report of the vacancies and strength of Ky regiments serving in the Department of the Cumberland, since July 28th 1864. The information contained in said reports is very Essential, and Enables me to keep the different commands fully officered as required. I respectfully call your attention to General Orders No 182 A. G. O. 1863. Section 2d.

By order of the Governor.
D. W. Lindsey
Inspt & Adj Genl Ky
